action.action-desc: Mr. Hill introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to clarify the funding of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Reserve Loss Transparency Act.
Section 1017(a) of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 (12 U.S.C. 5497(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (3) through (5) as paragraphs (4) through (6), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (2) the following:

paragraph.header: Prohibition on transfer when the Federal reserve banks incur a loss
paragraph.text: Notwithstanding paragraph (1), no transfer may be made to the Bureau if the Federal reserve banks, in the aggregate, incurred an operating loss in the most recently completed calendar quarter until the loss is offset with subsequent earnings.

section.header: Calculation of net earnings and total capital using GAAP
section.text: Section 7 of the Federal Reserve Act (12 U.S.C. 289 et seq.) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating the second subsection (b) (relating to the use of earnings transferred to the Secretary) and subsection (c) as subsections (c) and (d), respectively; and
by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Calculation of net earnings and total capital using GAAP
subsection.text: For purposes of this section, net earnings and total capital shall be calculated in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles.
